results.title: The Curiosity that kills the cat
results.creator_credit: Cedric Maggs, G. Buckland-Smith and British Films
results.brief_description: Shows the extent to which animals, specially bred for the purpose or imported wild from overseas, are used in medical research, the pharmaceutical industry and the cosmetic industry. Suggests that some of the vast sums of money spent on animal experiments might be devoted to the development of alternative, more humane techniques.

results.title: The Curb between us
results.brief_description: As a result of a car accident, Terry Kelly became a disabled person. After nine months in hospital Terry tries to rebuild his life with family, friends and his studies. Examines questions such as how it feels to be disabled and the prejudices and problems encountered by the disabled.

results.title: Cupid's complaint
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian Road Safety Council
results.brief_description: A rather solidly-built Cupid complains to his mother that he had picked out a beautifully matched couple and was bringing them together, but now, as a result of the girl not giving hand signals and the young man speeding, they have crashed into one another’s cars and are furious with each other.

results.title: Cummington story
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch
results.brief_description: The story of the arrival in Cummington, USA, of a group of refugees from Europe and the manner in which they were accepted by the community. They are greeted by the minister of the local church, who has assumed the responsibility for their adjustment to a strange country, and has found a place for them to live. Then began the process of gradually breaking down the barriers between the new arrivals and the townspeople. Strangeness falls away, the minister implies, when people live and work and meet together. The story of this exercise in human relations is told with sympathy, understanding, and humour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Office of War Information. Overseas Operations Branch

results.title: Cumberland story
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Jennings, Alexander Shaw and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary, made for the Ministry of Fuel and Power, aiming to reassure miners about the proposed nationalisation of the coal fields. Revolves around the dramatic tale of a disaster which involved the loss of many lives almost 100 years earlier. The seam located under the sea floor is opened up again for working, and with modern equipment and safety devices, there is little likelihood of a repetition of the old tragedy. Many of the roles are performed by the actual workers, Nimmo is played by a mining engineer and Stephenson is one of the mine leaders. Cinematography, Chick Fowle. Music, Arthur Benjamin performed by the Philharmonic Orchestra. Made in collaboration with the United Steel Companies and the National Union of Mine-Workers.

results.title: Cuckoo-spit (Froghoppers)
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Instructional Films
results.brief_description: An account of the life cycle of the froghopper showing all the stages of growth from the laying of eggs in the autumn through to the final change and emergence from the skin which takes place within the bubbles formation.

results.title: Cubism
results.creator_credit: George Barford and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Traces the development of cubism as a style of painting through the works of the artists who experimented with it. Shows how interest in Cezanne’s painting led Picasso and Braque to experiment with pictorial arrangement and to develop both analytical and synthetic cubism.
